name: Polysubstance-Induced Serotonin Syndrome
chief_complaint: I feel like my body is on fire, my muscles won't stop twitching, and I can't think straight
treatment: Benzodiazepines for agitation and muscle rigidity
prognosis: Guarded - mortality 2-12% in severe cases. Full recovery possible with prompt treatment, but risk of residual cognitive effects
description: Life-threatening condition caused by excessive serotonergic activity in CNS, typically from combination of serotonergic drugs (e.g., SSRIs + opioids + stimulants). Presents as a clinical triad of neuromuscular abnormalities, autonomic hyperactivity, and altered mental status.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of multiple serotonergic drugs
Recent dose increase of serotonergic agents
